arguments.description: - (Required) The zone to add the load balancer to.
- (Required) The DNS name to associate with the load balancer.
- (Required) The pool ID to use when all other pools are detected as unhealthy.
- (Required) A list of pool IDs ordered by their failover priority. Used whenever region/pop pools are not defined.
- (Optional) Time to live (TTL) of this load balancer's DNS . Conflicts with - this cannot be set for proxied load balancers. Default is .
- (Optional) Determine which method the load balancer uses to determine the fastest route to your origin. Valid values  are: "off", "geo", "dynamic_latency" or "". Default is "".
- (Optional) Whether the hostname gets Cloudflare's origin protection. Defaults to .
- (Optional) A set containing mappings of region/country codes to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the given region. Fields documented below.

- (Optional) A set containing mappings of Cloudflare Point-of-Presence (PoP) identifiers to a list of pool IDs (ordered by their failover priority) for the PoP (datacenter). This feature is only available to enterprise customers. Fields documented below.

- (Optional) Associates all requests coming from an end-user with a single origin. Cloudflare will set a cookie on the initial response to the client, such that consequent requests with the cookie in the request will go to the same origin, so long as it is available.
